revision.text:
{{Nihongo|'''Tateoka Doshun'''<ref name=Turnbull/>|楯岡ノ道順|Tateoka no Dōshun}} was an intermediate-ranking [[Iga-ryū|Iga]] [[ninja]] during the [[Sengoku period]]. He is also known as '''Igasaki Doshun'''<ref name=levy>Joel Levy , ''Ninja: The Shadow Warrior''</ref> or {{Nihongo|'''Igasaki Dōjun'''|伊賀崎道順}}.<ref>[[Stephen K. Hayes]], ''The Mystic Arts of the Ninja''</ref>
In 1558, during the [[Siege of Sawayama]], Tateoka Doshun and his 48 men (including four [[Kōga-ryū|Koga]] ninja) entered the [[Sawayama Castle]] by the use of ''bakemono-jutsu'' (ghost technique) of making [[paper lantern]]s displaying the enemy's badge. Dressed as a samurai and carrying the lanterns, they walked in unchallenged, then set fire to the castle, allowing [[Rokkaku Yoshikata]] to make a successful assault.<ref name=Turnbull>{{cite book |last=Turnbull |first=Stephen |title=Ninja: AD 1460-1650 |publisher=Osprey |location=University Park, Ill. |date=2003 |pages=43 |isbn=1-84176-525-2 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=3MnrpQRV-7wC&pg=PA43&dq=%22tateoka+doshun%22&hl=en&ei=cOliTtjtKpDF0AGl7M2TCg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%22tateoka%20doshun%22&f=false|accessdate=2011-09-03}}</ref> The same technique was also used by [[Matsudaira clan]] during the [[Siege of Kaminogō Castle]] in 1662.<ref name=levy/> There is a popular rumour concerning the death of Tateoka Doshun that [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]] had Doshun assassinated by [[Hattori Hanzō]] during the [[Battle of Komaki and Nagakute]] for giving information to the [[Toyotomi clan]].
==References== {{reflist}} {{People of the Sengoku period |state=collapsed}} [[Category:Japanese ninjutsu practitioners]] [[Category:Ninja]] [[Category:People of Muromachi-period Japan]] [[Category:Samurai]]
